definitions.definition: to raise your hand and move it from side to side as a way of greeting someone, telling someone to do something, or adding emphasis to an expression:
examples: I waved to/at him from the window but he didn't see me.

definitions.definition: to make a movement with your hand that tells someone to move in a particular direction:
examples: You'll have to wait till the policeman waves the car on.

definitions.definition: a raised line of water that moves across the surface of an area of water, especially the sea:
examples: At night, I listened to the sound of the waves breaking/crashing against the shore.
